str2: From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A locust. Apparently from the same as akron; a locust.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.

Contracted from a primary word; soil; by extension a region, or the solid part or the whole of the terrene globe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Feminine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.
From exesti; privilege, i.e. force, capacity, competency, freedom, or mastery, delegated influence.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

A scorpion. Probably from an obsolete skerpo; a 'scorpion'.
